question_text: Which of the following statements accurately describes a key difference between HDMI and DisplayPort connectors?
answer_options: DisplayPort supports audio but HDMI does not
HDMI uses packetized video, while DisplayPort does not
HDMI has a locking latch mechanism, while DisplayPort uses a friction fit
DisplayPort uses packetized video, while HDMI uses a continuous stream
correct_answer: DisplayPort uses packetized video, while HDMI uses a continuous stream
explanation: DisplayPort sends video and audio data using a packetized format similar to Ethernet. HDMI uses a more traditional continuous signal.
